name: Crowned River Turtle
description: The carapace is dark brown or black, the plastron yellow or black. Males are much smaller than females and differ by a longer, thicker tail.
food_note: Mainly aquatic plants, occasionally carrion of aquatic animals
proportions: Carapace length: males 17 cm, females 40–55 cm, weight: males up to 0.5 kg, females over 10 kg
attractions: It spends most of its life in water, hidden in muddy bottoms or floating motionlessly on the surface.
breeding: We’ve kept them since 2006, with the first offspring raised in 2012.
